Our goal is to integrate our code repository (Azure Repos) with Jira and there is a plugin “[Azure Pipelines for Jira|https://gcc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmarketplace.atlassian.com%2Fapps%2F1220515%2Fazure-pipelines-for-jira%3Fhosting%3Dcloud%26tab%3Dsupport&data=02%7C01%7CYashwanth.Bala%40jfs.ohio.gov%7Cf3a4f790bf7d4543e11b08d78dd56085%7C50f8fcc494d84f0784eb36ed57c7c8a2%7C0%7C1%7C637133819896647694&sdata=QXlezlSlFzBNZ7x%2FzCnqEmUckeM4saD8wzQRc3Ly67E%3D&reserved=0]” developed by Microsoft in Atlassian Marketplace that supports only for “*Jira Cloud*”, as per Microsoft they are unable to develop the plugin for Jira On premise as Atlassian didn't make development APIs available for Jira On-premise. Can you please make them available?
fields.summary: Make Development APIs available for Jira on-premise for plugin development
Allow thumbnails for hotlinked images
Summary (Activity/Statistics) for each project's component

fields.description:
Specifically, when a user does not have the *Delete Issues* permission, the user can still access the option when right-clicking an issue on a board, but receives an error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Software project with a board
# Sign in as a user that does not have the *Delete Issues* permission
# Right-click on an issue in the board

h3. Expected Behavior

The Delete Issue option does not show up

h3. Current Behavior

The Delete Issue option shows up and when selecting it, we see an error saying the user does not have permission
fields.summary: Have right-click menu reflect permissions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the Basic search, if you select a project, then add the Component field to the search and pick a component of that project, then change the project while keeping the current component in the search criteria. After changing the project the component field will get hidden and unable to be added back to the search criteria.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk project and a Jira Software project.
# Go to the issue navigator and start a basic search
# Select the SDS project in the search criteria, then add the Component field
# Pick any component available for the SDS project
# Change the project in the search criteria, to use only the JSW project.
# The component field will get hidden, and searching for it again will show the Component field greyed out, unable to be used.
# Changing to advanced search will show the filter using the same component still.

h3. Expected Results
You should be able to see the component field with the red exclamation and then use a valid component for the project.

h3. Actual Results
The component field gets hidden and unable to be added back to the basic search

h3. Workaround

Selecting both projects will allow you to remove the invalid component, or adjust the filter in the advanced search.
fields.summary: Component field hidden when selecting a different project in the basic search

fields.description: As a Jira administrators, we would like to have the option to use multi-factor authentication when going to the administrative area of Jira, where nowadays we are required to input the password again.
fields.summary: Add multi-factor authentication to administrative login

fields.description:
Hi Team,

Users would like to have an option to disable the user picker icon for the "Multi user picker" custom field in Jira.

While using custom field of type "User Picker (multiple users)" users will get option to select multiple users, when they click on people icon, it will list user attributes like user id, username and email in the pop-up. Users would like to disable this option.

The primary reason is to hide the email id of the users. The user picker icon will open pop up window and show the username email id details. Users want to restrict those user informations.

The user picker icon is not shown in Jira Cloud version.

Please help help with any existing workaround we can stick to for now, and also if the feature to enable/disable this icon for admins would be a great help.
fields.summary: Option to disable the user picker icon for the "Multi user picker" custom field in Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using JQL and ordering by Priority, the order issues by their priorities (e.g. descending), they will be ordered according to the importance of the priorities on the global list of priorities. 

The order from priority schemes is not relevant for JQL. 

This is confusing for users as they would expect the priority scheme order to designate the results when viewing from a project. 

This caveat is documented in [Associating Priorities with Projects|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/associating-priorities-with-projects-939514001.html]
h3. Steps to Reproduce
||Global list (Priorities page)||Custom priority scheme||
| # Urgent
 # Highest
 # Medium| # Highest
 # Urgent
 # Medium|

After appending a JQL query with e.g. {{ORDER BY priority DESC}}, the Urgent issues will be at the top of the list (followed by Highest, and then Medium), even if they’re in a project that uses the custom scheme. You can change the order in the default scheme on the [Priorities|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/defining-priority-field-values-938847101.html] page.
h3. Expected Results

When ordering priorities in the context of the project, the order should be determined by what is configured in that project's priority scheme. 
h3. Workaround

The only workaround is to change the order in the default scheme on the [Priorities|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/defining-priority-field-values-938847101.html] page.
fields.summary: As an admin, use the Priority Scheme when sorting by Priority using JQL.

fields.description:
Users who are familiar with mainstream SQL expect to be able to specify date fields down to the second.

We would like to be able to format JQL queries as follows:

createdDate >= "2013-01-11 00:00:00" and createdDate <= "2013-01-11 23:59:59"

We know that date data is stored in the database down to the second, as using createdDate <= "2013-01-11 23:59" excludes any issues created during the last minute of the day.
fields.summary: support for JQL queries to second resolution on datetime fields.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA Datacenter will automatically keep all the copies of the index up to date automatically. This synchronisation is not fully synchronous, but aims for eventual consistency. This means that there is some delay before index changes are seen on other nodes in the cluster. 

Each indexing operation writes a row to the database table _replicatedindexoperation_. All of the nodes then look for entries in this table that were inserted by nodes other than themselves. They then apply the changes to their local Lucene index by recollecting the CF values and recreating Lucene document. 

see [Lucene Index Synchronization in Jira Data Center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/lucene-index-synchronization-in-jira-data-center-800694054.html] for more details. 

In some cases, DC index replication takes longer due to the high volume of changes and expensive Custom Field computations.   This causes the replication queue to grow significantly and delay changes applied to the node. Those delays are affecting end-users. 

h3. Environment
* Jira DC
* Large number of Custom Fields

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# TBD

h3. Expected Results
Index replication is relatively fast and doesn't cause problem to end-users (eg, within 5min)

h3. Actual Results
Index replication queue grows significantly. Delay is 20+ min.
 
h3. Notes
* To check the _replication queue_ size, you can run API call {{/rest/api/2/index/summary}} and check _queueSize_ value. 
 
h3.Workaround
* Reduce the number of CF 
* Reduce complexity of expensive CF.
fields.summary: DC index replication delays are affecting end-users due to single thread processing and re-computation of CF values

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
JIRA Datacenter will automatically keep all the copies of the index up to date automatically. This synchronisation is not fully synchronous, but aims for eventual consistency. This means that there is some delay before index changes are seen on other nodes in the cluster. 

Each indexing operation writes a row to the database table replicatedindexoperation. All of the nodes then look for entries in this table that were inserted by nodes other than themselves. They then apply the changes to their local Lucene index by recollecting the CF values and recreating Lucene document. 

see [Lucene Index Synchronization in Jira Data Center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/lucene-index-synchronization-in-jira-data-center-800694054.html] for more details. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Replicate Lucene document between nodes (Document-based replication - DBR). 
Thus reduce overhead to recollect the CF values and recreate Lucene document. 
 
h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Create Lucene document based replication for Jira DC for index replication
Ability to disable the Apps Carousel in Find New Apps

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Value for a number-type custom field is saved truncated through REST API

h3. Steps to Reproduce
This is a 2 scenarios problem, and requires clarification on which behavior is the correct one:
*Scenario 1:*
# Create a number type custom field.
# Add the custom field to the screens of any issue type.
# Create an issue of that issue type.
# Edit the issue and set the value to the custom number field to something with 4 or more digits after the decimal separator (like 9.987654321).

*Scenario 2:*
# Create a number type custom field.
# Add the custom field to the screens of any issue type.
# Create an issue of that issue type.
# Set the value of the custom number field to something with 4 or more digits after the decimal separator (like 9.987654321) using REST API (<base URL>/rest/api/2/issue/{Issue key})

h3. Actual Results
Scenario 1: the value is saved entirely in the database, with the UI only showing 3 digits after the decimal separator (rounding up the last digit): 
 !image-2019-12-20-18-17-35-897.png|thumbnail! 

Scenario 2: the value is saved only with 3 digits after the decimal separator, with the 3rd digit rounded up:
 !image-2019-12-20-18-18-24-763.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
At this moment, it is unknown which of the behaviors is the intended one, requires clarification.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Value for a number-type custom field is saved truncated through REST API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Starting in February 2020, Chrome version 80 (and later Firefox and IE as well) will start enforcing different requirements on cross-site cookies:
* The new secure-by-default model assumes all cookies should be protected from external access unless otherwise specified. Developers must use a new cookie setting, `_SameSite=None_`, to designate cookies for cross-site access.
* With Chrome 80 will treat cookies that have no declared SameSite value as `_SameSite=Lax_` cookies.

Reference [https://blog.chromium.org/2019/10/developers-get-ready-for-new.html] for full details on the change in Chrome's behavior.

With this new functionality enabled in Chrome the avatars from Confluence users in the activity stream are broken.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # (prior to the Chrome version 80 rollout) In Chrome version 77+ go to "chrome://flags/"
 # Search for "SameSite" and enable "SameSite by default cookies" and "Cookies without SameSite must be secure"
 # Navigate to the Jira System Dashboard (with an application link to Confluence already in place)
 # View the "Activity Stream" to see amongst other things, updates from Confluence

h3. Expected Results

You will see a list of activity from Confluence with the user's avatar next to it

!image-2019-12-19-18-35-46-402.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

Activity is displayed but avatar is broken
 !image-2019-12-19-18-18-30-520.png|thumbnail!

h3. Note
Cookies from Jira doesn't have any *SameSite* policy attached, because of that Chrome forces "SameSite=LAX". That breaks content inclusion since avatars loading requires a valid Jira session to be provided. 

Jira (JAC):
 !JAC_cookies.png|thumbnail!

Blogger:
!blogger_cookies.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

# On Chrome, navigate to chrome://flags/
# Search for *SameSite*.
# Make sure the following options are *Enabled*:
** SameSite by default cookies
** Cookies without SameSite must be secure
fields.summary: When Chrome enforces SameSite=LAX setting, Avatars from Confluence in the Activity Stream are broken

fields.description:
When performing a request to Jira Data Center using the REST API, the node ID is present in the HTTP header of the response as _X-ANODEID_.

It is requested that the node ID is included in a REST call, such as _serverInfo_ for example, as it would be useful for debugging purposes when writing scripts.
fields.summary: Node ID in REST payload (not just in header)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, Jira does not support to configure IMAP or SMTP to use certificate based authentication. Only available option is to use username and password authentication.

 

h3. Suggested Solution

Implement a feature to configure IMAP or SMTP to use Certificate-based authentication to access the mailbox in Exchange instead of using username and password.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/exchange/plan-and-deploy/post-installation-tasks/configure-certificate-based-auth?view=exchserver-2019

h3. Workaround 

n/a
fields.summary: Ability to configure SMTP or IMAP to use Certificate based authentication for mailbox

h3. Issue Summary

 

We would like to have an option to restrict the 'Advanced' schedule which uses Cron Expression when managing Filter Subscriptions to only Administrators.

For the use case, as a Jira user, we can create a filter and subscribe to it using cron expression. You can make a cron job running every second. This is a risk that affects system performance, if many users create such subscriptions.

fields.description: The version of the Application Links plugin used in Jira before version 8.4.2 allows remote attackers to obtain information about configured application links via a missing permissions check. See https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/APL-1386 for more details.
fields.summary: Information disclosure in the listEntityLinks servlet resource of the Application links plugin - CVE-2019-15011

fields.description: The login.jsp resource in Jira before version 8.5.2, and from version 8.6.0 before version 8.6.1 allows remote attackers to redirect users to a different website which they may use as part of performing a phishing attack via an open redirect in the os_destination parameter.
fields.summary: Open redirect vulnerability in login.jsp - CVE-2019-20901

fields.description:
The usage of Tomcat in Jira  before version 8.5.2 allows local attackers with permission to write a dll file to a directory in the global path environmental variable can inject code into  via a DLL hijacking vulnerability.

h3. Acknowledgment

We would like to thank Peleg Hadar of SafeBreach Labs for reporting this vulnerability.
fields.summary: Jira on Windows was vulnerable to DLL hijacking - CVE-2019-20400

fields.description:
Various installation setup resources in Jira before version 8.5.2 allow remote attackers to configure a Jira instance, which has not yet finished being installed, via Cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerabilities.

Once a Jira instance is setup (i.e. database, admin account, licence, etc. form are filled) the vulnerability can't be exploited anymore.
fields.summary: Various Jira Server setup resources are vulnerable to XSRF/CSRF - CVE-2019-20401

fields.description: The WorkflowResource class removeStatus method in Jira before version 7.13.12, from version 8.0.0 before version 8.4.3, and from version 8.5.0 before version 8.5.2 allows authenticated remote attackers who do not have project administration access to remove a configured issue status from a project via a missing authorisation check.
fields.summary: Improper authorization check in the WorkflowResource class removeStatus method - CVE-2019-15013

fields.description:
It would really be beneficial if we could update the "original estimate" "start date" and "due date" from a filter without having to leave the filter to go into the issue.  Often we make date updates in a meeting (not always are the issues moving to the same date), and it would be helpful if this was an option.

!image-2019-12-16-15-02-12-132.png!
fields.summary: Able to edit task dates (start date/due deate) and estimates in filter view without opening the issue

fields.description:
{panel}
*I'm running Jira Server 7.2 ATM.*

*If this is possible in newer versions please let me know. I haven't found that information.*
{panel}
 

Much in the same way the other time functions like startOfDay() can be given a parameter it would be very nice to be able to use *now(-x)*. 

Use case:
 * I want to set up an "issue collector" that avery certain ammount of time returns every created issue since in the last specified ammount of time that also matches a series of conditions.

Let's say:
 * On monday mornings notifies of every matching issue created since I last left office. That would be automate a task executing every monday at 8h with the following JQL as a filter *"createdDate >= now(-2d 14h) AND _extra conditions_"*
 * During office hours execute an automate task every half hour with the following JQL as a filter *"createdDate >= now(-30m) AND _extra conditions_"*
 * From tuesday to friday notifies of every matching issue created since last day. That would be automate a task executing everyday at 8h with the following JQL as a filter *"createdDate >= now(-14h) AND _extra conditions_"*
fields.summary: Allow now() function to take parameters

fields.description: Some times we need to export the list of active Jira users . But right now there is no way to do it. Can you please add this option?
fields.summary: Ability to export JIRA users in a excel sheet

https://github.com/minfrin/atlassian-rpms/blob/master/jira/atlassian-jira-core-8.5.1-1.el7.nosrc.rpm

The language packs in the original binaries have corrupted POMs, and so the files have had to be excluded.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
PostgreSQL database doesn't allow null ({{\0}}) character to be saved as text field ([link|https://www.postgresql.org/message-id/alpine.BSO.2.00.0906031639270.2432%40leary.csoft.net]). This is not correctly handled by Jira's ORM.

The issue by itself should only make it impossible to save the issue with the incorrect data, but it is also a trigger for JRASERVER-70333.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up Jira on PostgreSQL database,
 # Create new project,
 # Create new text custom field and add it to issue scheme for this project,
 # Generate any non empty string which is not allowed by the PostgreSQL, for instance:
 ** based on [this|https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1347646/postgres-error-on-insert-error-invalid-byte-sequence-for-encoding-utf8-0x0] generate string with empty character,
 ** open developer tools in you browser,
 ** in console invoke "*console.log('a\0a')*" function(the output will be "*aa*" but for real there will be an empty character between the '*a*' letters),
 ** copy paste the output to the custom field,
 # Try to create the issue
 # Check the log

h3. Expected Results
Either:
* The problem is handled by ORM
* Null character is forbidden on the field validator level
* Null character is removed from the field

Error message presented to the user reads as follows:
{noformat}
We can't create this issue for you right now, it could be due to unsupported content you've entered into one or more of the issue fields. If this situation persists, contact your administrator as they'll be able to access more specific information in the log file.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In JRASERVER-68806 we decreased the size of the {{EagerLoadingOfBizCustomFieldPersister}} cache from infinite to 10. This works well for operations such as CSV export and indexing, which access each issue only once. However, there are some bulk operations that iterate over the same issues multiple times. So far we have identified these:
 * bulk issue edit
 * changing project issue type scheme (requires issue type mapping) (70 mins for 21k issues)

In these cases, the cache that holds values for the last 10 issues is constantly being reloaded, which makes it practically as there _is no cache_ (see notes below).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # <TBD>

h3. Expected Results
 * Bulk issue operations are fast
 * DB is not overloaded with requests

h3. Actual Results
 * bulk issue operations are slow
 * Large number of SQL operations querying {{customfieldvalue}} table:
{noformat}
SELECT ID, ISSUE, CUSTOMFIELD, UPDATED, PARENTKEY, STRINGVALUE, NUMBERVALUE, TEXTVALUE, DATEVALUE, VALUETYPE FROM customfieldvalue WHERE ISSUE='<ID>'
{noformat}

h3. Notes

Example of thread doing _BulkMigrateOperation_, merged by operations, you can see that cache constantly being reloaded:
{noformat}
"https-jsse-nio-8443-exec-6 url:/secure/admin/M...chooseContext.jspa username:user1" count=11 prio=5 tid=0x00007f18a9bc8800 nid=0xa70b runnable [0x00007f1739d67000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE100.00%   [11/11]\ at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.issuetypes.MigrateIssueTypes.doChooseContext(MigrateIssueTypes.java:81)
100.00%   [11/11] \ at com.atlassian.jira.bulkedit.operation.BulkMigrateOperation.chooseContextNoValidate(BulkMigrateOperation.java:248)
100.00%   [11/11]  \ at com.atlassian.jira.bulkedit.operation.BulkMoveOperationImpl.chooseContextNoValidate(BulkMoveOperationImpl.java:333)
100.00%   [11/11]   \ at com.atlassian.jira.bulkedit.operation.BulkMoveOperationImpl.finishChooseContext(BulkMoveOperationImpl.java:482)
100.00%   [11/11]    \ at com.atlassian.jira.bulkedit.operation.BulkMoveOperationImpl.setMoveFieldLayoutItems(BulkMoveOperationImpl.java:919)
100.00%   [11/11]     X at com.atlassian.jira.bulkedit.operation.BulkMoveOperationImpl.fieldNeedsMove(BulkMoveOperationImpl.java:958)
  9.09%    [1/11]     |\ at com.atlassian.jira.web.bean.BulkEditBeanImpl.getFirstTargetIssueObject(BulkEditBeanImpl.java:685)
  9.09%    [1/11]     | \ at com.atlassian.jira.web.bean.BulkEditBeanImpl.getTargetIssueObjects(BulkEditBeanImpl.java:697)
  ....
 90.91%   [10/11]      \ at com.atlassian.jira.bulkedit.operation.BulkMoveOperationImpl.fieldNeedsMove(BulkMoveOperationImpl.java:989)
 90.91%   [10/11]       \ at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.ImmutableCustomField.needsMove(ImmutableCustomField.java:1058)
 90.91%   [10/11]        \ at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.ImmutableCustomField.doesFieldHaveValue(ImmutableCustomField.java:1179)
 90.91%   [10/11]         \ at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.ImmutableCustomField.getValue(ImmutableCustomField.java:350)
 90.91%   [10/11]          \ at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.AbstractSingleFieldType.getValueFromIssue(AbstractSingleFieldType.java:73)
 90.91%   [10/11]           \ at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.AbstractSingleFieldType.getValueFromIssue(AbstractSingleFieldType.java:87)
 90.91%   [10/11]            \ at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.persistence.OfBizCustomFieldValuePersister.getValues(OfBizCustomFieldValuePersister.java:65)
 90.91%   [10/11]             \ at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.persistence.OfBizCustomFieldValuePersister.getValues(OfBizCustomFieldValuePersister.java:73)
 90.91%   [10/11]              \ at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.persistence.EagerLoadingOfBizCustomFieldPersister.getValuesForTypeAndParent(EagerLoadingOfBizCustomFieldPersister.java:86)
 90.91%   [10/11]               \ at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.persistence.EagerLoadingOfBizCustomFieldPersister.getValuesForIssueId(EagerLoadingOfBizCustomFieldPersister.java:103)
 90.91%   [10/11]                \ at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$LocalManualCache.get(LocalCache.java:4739)
 .... 
 90.91%   [10/11]                   X at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericHelperDAO.findByAnd(GenericHelperDAO.java:166)
 45.45%    [5/11]                      \ at oracle.jdbc.driver.InsensitiveScrollableResultSet.next(InsensitiveScrollableResultSet.java:406)
{noformat}
 
h3. Workaround
 * Increase the cache size (_jira.customfield.values.cache.max.size_) to hold required number of issues (default 10). This is done by introducing the following [JVM startup argument|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/setting-properties-and-options-on-startup-938847831.html], for example, to increase the cache size to 1000:
{code:java}
-Djira.customfield.values.cache.max.size=1000
{code}
fields.summary: Bulk issue edit operations are slow and performance is degraded with small EagerLoadingOfBizCustomFieldPersister cache

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Newline characters are accepted in Component and Label fields when copy-pasting from another text editor.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit the current issue.
 # Type in Label and Component field to have a Newline character.
 # Jira treats the newline character as a separator between two labels OR components.
 # Open a text editor, type in a text with newline characters in it.
 # Copy-paste this text to Label OR Component field
 # Jira treats this as a single label OR component field
 # Tested in all the browsers, observed similar behavior. 

h3. Expected Results

Behavior should be the same when user typing in or copy-paste. Jira should or should not accept the new line characters.
h3. Actual Results

Jira accepts newline character when copy-pasting the text, however, does not accept when typing in.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: New line character is accepted for Component and Label field

fields.description:
The Jira Cloud platform documentation has a few pieces of documentation that help guide developers in a great way, with examples and scripts, this kind of documentation does not seem to be available in Server. Other than users having additional trouble getting some things to work without examples, this can also cause confusion as they might find the documentation for Cloud, and try to apply it to Server, which sometimes could work, but often it will not.

The suggestion is to give the documentation for Server an update to have examples like the following link from Cloud: https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/connect-cookbook/
fields.summary: Improve documentation for developers for the Server platform.

fields.description:
The Jira mobile app does not have a feature to remember users' credentials. After a certain time, it will ask for the user to log in again, and this can be annoying, considering that other mobile applications have integrated this function in one way or the other ("remember me" checks, fingerprint login, etc).

The request is to add a function to allow the Mobile app to stay logged for long periods of time (like 30 days, for example).
fields.summary: Add a Remember Me function to the Jira Mobile App

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Copying Issue ID in board sprint view > issue detail view copies some hidden text into clipboard "Actions (Type . to access issue actions)"

h3. Environment
 # Chrome browser
 # Jira 8.3.x
Note: Unable to reproduce on 7.13.11. Does not affect Firefox and IE.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to any active sprint
 # Click on any issue in the sprint to bring up the issue detail view
 # Copy the issue ID in issue detail view to clipboard and paste it
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Issue ID is copied, ie: 
{code}SSP-32{code}

h3. Actual Results
Issue ID and some hidden text are copied to clipboard, ie:
{code}SSP-32
Actions (Type . to access issue actions){code}

h3. Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Copying Issue ID in board sprint view > issue detail view copies some hidden text into clipboard "Actions (Type . to access issue actions)"

fields.description:
As an administrator, I would like to be able to delete the change issue history rows.
One of our customers stored some confidential/sensitive information in the fields. 
They cleared out that info now, but it still shows in the change history.

There is a third-party plugin able to accomplish this, but not available for Jira DC.
There are some Script Runners scripts, but they delete all the change history. It doesn't allow to delete/update a particular row on the history.
And finally, DB manipulation to accomplish this.

It would be nice to have an OOB feature, so admins can easily remove rows from issue's history tab.
fields.summary: As an administrator I would like to be able to delete change issue history

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Inserting "{ }" in a table in the comments while in visual mode breaks the table format. 
 Jira automatically adds \
 Which breaks the table format.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a table in the comments in visual mode in any issue.
 # Add a second row
 # Add a text
 # Save the comment, you will see the table is viewing as expected.
 # Edit the comment, add "{ }" between all the text
 #  Save the comment, the table format will break.

 (+) A video of the steps to reproduce the issue is attached here  [^bug.mp4] 












h3. Expected Results
 Table format does not break and shows the text between"{ }"
h3. Actual Results

The table format breaks and Jira adds \
 which you can see if text mode, which makes the table to break when adding "{ }" to text
h3. Workaround

Use "( )" instead of "{ }"
fields.summary: Inserting { } in a table in the comments while in visual mode breaks the table format

fields.description:
Presently all other email notifications in Jira contain issue summary in the subject line other than @mention notifications which do not contain issue summary in the subject line at the moment. It would be good to have the issue summary in the subject line of the email notification we get when someone mentions you in a comment.

Enclosing the screenshot of the current mention email notification.
 !image-2019-12-12-21-55-40-039.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Mention emails should contain issue summary in the subject line.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a user opens the Create Issue screen, it sets the Priority to the default for the selected Project. If the user then switches to a different Project that's using a different Priority Scheme, it does NOT apply the new default Priority. It simply retains the original value selected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Pre Conditions:
- ProjectA is using a Priority Scheme that has the Default set to P3
- ProjectB is using a Priority Scheme that has the Default set to P2

1. View ProjectA.
2. Open the Create Issue screen.
3. Confirm it loads with ProjectA as the Project and the Priority is correctly set to P3.
4. Without making any changes, switch the Project to ProjectB.



h3. Expected Results
It should apply the new P2 default.

h3. Actual Results
The Priority remains P3.

h3. Workaround

Close the create window and open again
fields.summary: Priority Scheme Default not applied when switching projects during issue create
Audit log for change to Status configuration

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The webhook JQL filter configuration goes missing only in Firefox. 

Not reproducible on Chrome. 

h3. Environment
*  Mozilla Firefox

h3. Steps Support used to Reproduce
# Open Chrome
# Create a webhook with JQL for an issue related event :
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# Save the webhook
# Open the same page on firefox ( You may need to refresh the page a few times )

h3. Steps Customer provided to Reproduce
a) Enter a query into the webhook and save.
b) On the webhook overview hit reload / F5 in the browser -> query gone in the overview -> go to edit -> it's still there in the edit view.
c) Log out of Jira and log back in -> query gone in the overview -> go to edit -> it's gone there as well.

h3. Expected Results
It should show the JQL configuration on the webhook overview page :
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
If using Firefox, it goes missing: 
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
# Clicking edit in firefox will clear the JQL as well which is why this is raised as Major and this can be saved: !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail! 
# Clicking edit in Chrome does not clear the JQL

h3.Workaround

Do not use Mozilla Firefox for now.
fields.summary: Webhook JQL configuration goes missing in Firefox

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently the mobile app for Jira, it is not possible to select the issue-level security, like it would be possible in Jira and in the web browser mobile view.

h3. Environment
JSW 8.x onwards

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable [JIRA Issue Security|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-issue-level-security-776636711.html]
# Create an issue in JIRA desktop version, set security level on a new or existing issue
# Try to perform the same in JIRA mobile app

h3. Expected Results
JIRA mobile application should display the security level field at the time of creating or editing issues

h3. Actual Results
Security level field is missing on new or edit screen in JIRA mobile application

h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3. Workaround
Security level can only be set in JIRA web browser version
fields.summary: Issue level security field is missing in Mobile App for Jira Server

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
With connected applications with Jira, Smart commit will check only for Jira Project Key set.

If using the default Jira project Key will not detect Jira issues if they have special characters 
"CAPS_DEVSIX-1111" 

Jira Project Keys must contain regular expression as  (([A-Z][A-Z])-([0-9]+))  and be used in Smart commits to detect issue ID instead of the default ([A-Z][A-Z]+) 

h3. Suggested Solution
Use [Use Smart Commits|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/use-smart-commits-298979931.html] as default.
fields.summary: Jira Project Key must contain Issue ID in Regular expression for smart commits
Clear NGINX's cache after Jira upgrade to 7.13
/status returns 'Running' despite the instance being Johnsoned

fields.description:
h4. Summary
At this moment, [Jira Cloud for Outlook (Official)|https://appsource.microsoft.com/es-es/product/office/WA200000056?tab=Overview] is only available for Jira Cloud users but not for Jira Server users. It would be great if we can also roll out this feature for the server users so that it would be possible for them to also create issue from Outlook.
fields.summary: Jira Server for Outlook

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment we just can use the following fields in the Issue Collector feature:
 * Standard Fields: Summary, Description, Components, AffectsVersion, Environment, Priority, Attachment
 * Custom Field Types: Date Time, Radio Buttons, Multi-Checkbox, Multi-Select, Number, Select List, URL field, Version Picker, Cascading Select, Project Picker, Single Version Picker, Text Field, Free Text Field

h3. Suggested Solution
Add "Due Date" to the list of fields that can be used in the issue collector.
fields.summary: Enable Due Date field in Issue Collector

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Workflow transition button cut off in small browser screen if ops.bar.group.size.opsbar-transitions setting is set to large number
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a workflow with large number of status and set it to use Global transition.
 !View Workflow — Long workflow status - Jira 824 - Google Chrome 2019-12-11 13.05.26.png|thumbnail! 
# On jira-config.properties, add  ops.bar.group.size.opsbar-transitions setting to be large value such as 15.
# Restart JIRA.
# Go to issue details view.

h3. Expected Results
All of the transition button to show up properly in small browser screen.
h3. Actual Results
The transition button cut off at the end of the page.
*Small browser screen*
 ![PM-1] This is your first task - Jira 824 - Google Chrome 2019-12-11 13.11.39.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Add below css in *Announcement banner* should show the remaining button on next line instead of cutting it off at the end:
{code}
<style>
.aui-toolbar2 .aui-buttons {
    white-space: normal;
}
</style>
{code}
 ![PM-1] This is your first task - Jira 824 - Google Chrome 2019-12-11 13.27.33.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Workflow transition button cut off in small browser screen if ops.bar.group.size.opsbar-transitions setting is set to large number

fields.description:
I want to be able to expand the push notifications (Issue Update) so that we can choose if we want to get notified when people use the "Edit" button. 

I don't know if this works the same with in-line edits, but a lot of our users rely on the Edit button to make updates.

The fact that the Issue update event only supports *Description* and *attachments* is simply not enough. What about a crucial custom field update? What about a change in priority? We could be missing the timely windows to receive updates while using Jira Mobile.
fields.summary: As a Jira administrador I would like to be able to get push notifications for issue update event not only when the description or attachment is added/changed

fields.description:
h3. Summary
As indicated in the guide *[How to Configure an Outbound HTTP and HTTPS Proxy for JIRA applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-configure-an-outbound-http-and-https-proxy-for-jira-applications-247857187.html]:*
{quote}This Outbound Proxy configuration only works for HTTP and HTTPs request only. If you are trying to connect JIRA to a Mail Server (Gmail or Office365) or to an LDAP Server, this configuration will not work.{quote}

h3. Suggestion
The suggestion is to improve the Mail server configuration so it works using the proxy like any other Jira function when an outbound proxy is configured.
fields.summary: Allow the Mail server configuration to use outbound proxy settings

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Project Component page is empty when more than one issue is associated with a Component and the user language is Slovak.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change the user language to Slovak(slovenčina):
 # Create a new component and associate one issue with it. The component page loads without issue:
 !image-2019-12-09-23-40-56-603.png|thumbnail!
 # Now create more issues and associate with the same component.
 # Once two or more issues are associated, the component page is blank:
 !image-2019-12-09-23-41-38-073.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

The component page should load when two or more issues are associated with the component and the instance language is Slovak:
h3. Actual Results
 - The component page is not loading when two or more issues are associated with a component and the instance language is Slovak
 - The following error is thrown in the Browser Console:
{code:java}
batch.js?locale=sk-SK:204 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property '1' of null
    at i (batch.js?locale=sk-SK:204)
    at batch.js?locale=sk-SK:204
    at Object.t [as format] (batch.js?locale=sk-SK:204)
    at Object.JIRA.Projects.Components.Templates.issuesRow (com.atlassian.jira.jira-projects-plugin:components-page-assets.js?locale=sk-SK:133)
    at JIRA.Projects.Components.Templates.row (com.atlassian.jira.jira-projects-plugin:components-page-assets.js?locale=sk-SK:85)
    at Object.render (batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&healthcheck-resources=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&locale=sk-SK:3146)
    at d._renderTemplate (batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&healthcheck-resources=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&locale=sk-SK:3153)
    at d.render (batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&healthcheck-resources=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&locale=sk-SK:3152)
    at d.renderChildView (batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&healthcheck-resources=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&locale=sk-SK:3161)
    at d._addChildView (batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&healthcheck-resources=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&locale=sk-SK:3160)
{code}

(i) Tested for the English language as well and it works without any problem. The problem seems to be happening just for the Slovak language:
 !image-2019-12-09-23-42-39-758.png|thumbnail!

The issue is reproducible on version 8.2.x
h3. Workaround
 # Navigate to the folder <JIRA_INSTALL>/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins
 # You should see a file called {{jira-core-language-pack-sk_SK-8.5.0.v20190920192957.jar}}. (!) *Note that the name might change slightly depending on the Jira version that you are using*
 # Copy this file to a temporary directory outside of the Jira installation folder
 # Change the filetype of this file from JAR to ZIP as well to make it extractable
 # Unzip the file into a new folder
 # Look for the file that contains the incorrect Slovak translation for the project components page. In this case, the file is {{com/atlassian/jira/web/action/JiraWebActionSupport_sk_SK.properties}}
 # Look for the following line:
{code:java}
common.concepts.issues.with.count={0,choice,0\#{0} Po\u017eiadaviek|1\#{0} Po\u017eiadaviek|1<{0} Po\u017eiadaviek}
{code}
 # Replace it with the following line:
{code:java}
common.concepts.issues.with.count={0,choice,0\#{0} Po\u017eiadaviek|1\#{0} Po\u017eiadaviek|1<{0} Po\u017eiadaviek}
{code}
 # Save the file
 # Using the terminal, navigate to the directory where all the files were extracted from the original jar file
 # From inside the directory, run the following command:
{code:java}
jar cf jira-core-language-pack-sk_SK-8.5.0.v20190920192957.jar * {code}
# The new Jar file {{jira-core-language-pack-sk_SK-8.5.0.v20190920192957.jar}} will be created including the fixed translation
 # Go to the page ⚙ > Manage Apps > Manage Apps, and upload the new jar file using the *Upload App* button

(!) Important Note: after the new Jar file is updated, the changes will only take effect *after the browser cache is cleared*. Another way to check if the translation is working is to either open the browser in Incognito mode, or by using a different browser

h3. Definition
Just like how Epic Status works where we can create a condition that issues can't be added as Epic Link if the Epic Status is already resolved, it would be great if the same concept can be applied to Initiatives.

h3. Suggestion
Introduce Parent Link Status field.

fields.description:
The European GDPR forces every platform provider of internet applications to provide proper privacy and imprint information individually on that platform.

We encountered that there is no easy way in Jira to provide that Information.
As you as software provider need to keep us as customer your might assist us keep Jira running by providing at least a simple ability to set custom "privacy" and "imprint" links on every Jira site (I think in that footer where also "about jira" and "Report a Problem" and so on is linked is a good place). We could create websites to present this information.

A better approach would be to have the gdpr/privacy/imprint information to be customizable in Jira admin interface and simply klickable. But afaik this might be a bigger change.
fields.summary: Add customizable "privacy" and "imprint" Links in Footer

fields.description:
I would like to have more than one kind of priority field.

A new type of custom field would be necessary - "Priority".

The values would be picked from existing priorities defined in Jira instance.

Example of use case in a project:
 * Priority - Jira default field, values e.g. Low/Medium/High
 * Incident priority - custom field, values e.g. P1/P2/P3/P4
 * Business priority - Must have/Medium/Nice to have
fields.summary: New type of custom field - priority

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When searching for an issue created on a date (Ex. 27/Nov/2019) by using the issue navigator "created = 2019-11-27" it does not work. 

Search for dates with "<=" *&* ">=" & "=" does not work if you choose the same day.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Create an issue (created on Nov 27)

* Try finding it in the issue navigator using as the parameter the create date of the issue:

{code:sql}
created >= 2019-11-27 AND created <= 2019-11-27
{code}
h3. Expected Results
Shows results of the issues created on 2019/Nov/27.
h3. Actual Results
No results are returned. 
h3. Notes
You could also use the date picker in the Basic search to reproduce this issue. Just choose From 2019/Nov/27 to 2019/Nov/27. 
h3.Workaround
* Use a day after the desired date to show the issues.

If I change the query to use 2019/Nov/27 and 2019/Nov/28 it show results of the issues created on 2019/Nov/27.

{code}
created >= 2019-11-27 AND created <= 2019-11-28
{code}
fields.summary: Date range in issue navigator is not working properly "Created Date"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the Azure template, deploying to a Postgres database fails (deploying to SQL Server completes successfully).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Use the Azure template to deploy Jira 8.4 or higher
# Choose Postgres as your database

h3. Expected Results

Jira successfully deploys a Postgres database and Jira 8.4+ instance and connects to it.

h3. Actual Results

Jira fails to start with the following error
{code}
2019-12-05 19:04:35,598 localhost-startStop-1 ERROR      [c.a.config.bootstrap.DefaultAtlassianBootstrapManager] Could not successfully test your database: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: Could not open SSL root certificate file /home/jira/.postgresql/root.crt.
{code}

h3. Workaround

This appears to be caused by the updated Postgres driver that's included in Jira 8.4 and above.

The following workaround (performed on all nodes) appears to resolve the issue, however:

{code}
sudo su -
service jira stop
rm -f /opt/atlassian/jira/lib/postgresql-9.4.1211.jar
curl -LO https://www.digicert.com/CACerts/BaltimoreCyberTrustRoot.crt
openssl x509 -inform DER -in BaltimoreCyberTrustRoot.crt -text -out root.crt
mkdir -p /home/jira/.postgresql
cp root.crt /home/jira/.postgresql
chown jira:jira /home/jira/.postgresql/root.crt
service jira start
{code}
fields.summary: Deploying to Postgres using the Azure template fails

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira displays it's own version number in several pages, including the page markup and application footer. 

Some of these pages are available unauthenticated, for instance, the login and logout pages.

Jira administrators may wish to hide these version numbers from users as there may be a requirement to not identify the running product version, particularly to unauthenticated users. 
h3. Actual Result

Version number can be found in the page markup, for example:
 * {{<meta name="application-name" content="JIRA" data-name="jira" data-version="8.5.0">}}
 * {{<input type="hidden" title="JiraVersion" value="8.5.0">}}
 * {{jira/s/...-CDN/dexrks/805000/.../.../_/download/contextbatch/css/jira.login,_super/batch.css}}

And is displayed in the Jira footer (eg):
 * {{Atlassian Jira Project Management Software (v8.5.0#805000-sha1:8875eca)}}

 
h3. Suggested Result  

A) By default, hide the version number being displayed on unauthenticated pages (EG, login/logout)

_and/or_

B) Provide a toggle switch in Jira Admin to hide the version number being displayed in other "logged in" areas of Jira 
h3. Workaround

We have added a workaround in the KB article [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Hiding+the+Jira+version+number+from+page+markup]

Please take care to note the workarounds limitation.
fields.summary: As a Jira Admin, I want to hide the version number showing to unauthenticated users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira have outgoing http connections even though disabled Analytics
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # _Jira Administration > System > Analytics_ Disabled analytics
 # Restart Jira and see outgoing connection through forward proxy or [debug outgoing connections|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-enable-debug-logging-for-outgoing-http-connections-in-jira-952073102.html]
{code:java}
172.20.0.5 - proxyuser [05/Dec/2019:05:13:11 +0000] "CONNECT btf-analytics.s3.dualstack.us-east-1.amazonaws.com:443 HTTP/1.1" 200 - "-" "Apache-HttpClient/4.5.5 (Java/1.8.0_232)"
...
172.20.0.5 - proxyuser [05/Dec/2019:06:13:14 +0000] "CONNECT server-notifications.atlassian.com:443 HTTP/1.1" 200 - "-" "Apache-HttpClient/4.5.5 (Java/1.8.0_232)"
172.20.0.5 - proxyuser [05/Dec/2019:06:13:14 +0000] "CONNECT server-notifications.atlassian.com:443 HTTP/1.1" 200 - "-" "Apache-HttpClient/4.5.5 (Java/1.8.0_232)"
{code}

h3. Expected Results

There is no outgoing connection related analytics if it's disabled.
h3. Actual Results
 - Every 6 hours, Jira sent request to {{server-notifications.atlassian.com}} to get latest news from atlassian.
{code}
172.20.0.5 - proxyuser [05/Dec/2019:06:13:14 +0000] "CONNECT server-notifications.atlassian.com:443 HTTP/1.1" 200 - "-" "Apache-HttpClient/4.5.5 (Java/1.8.0_232)"
172.20.0.5 - proxyuser [05/Dec/2019:06:13:14 +0000] "CONNECT server-notifications.atlassian.com:443 HTTP/1.1" 200 - "-" "Apache-HttpClient/4.5.5 (Java/1.8.0_232)"
{code}
{code:java|title=clusteredjob table}
id     job_id                                       job_runner_key                               sched_type  interval_millis  first_run      cron_expression  time_zone  next_run       version  parameters  
-----  -------------------------------------------  -------------------------------------------  ----------  ---------------  -------------  ---------------  ---------  -------------  -------  ----------  
18514  com.atlassian.whisper.plugin.fetch.FetchJob  com.atlassian.whisper.plugin.fetch.FetchJob  I           21600000         1575514489169  (null)           (null)     1575536715200  2        (null)      
{code}

 - Jira sent request to {{btf-analytics.s3.dualstack.us-east-1.amazonaws.com}} when start Jira application to get hash code that is used for analysis
{code:java}
172.20.0.5 - proxyuser [05/Dec/2019:05:13:11 +0000] "CONNECT btf-analytics.s3.dualstack.us-east-1.amazonaws.com:443 HTTP/1.1" 200 - "-" "Apache-HttpClient/4.5.5 (Java/1.8.0_232)"
{code}

h3. Workaround

Disable {{Analytics Client Plugin}} and {{Atlassian Notifications Plugin}} from _Jira Administration > Add-ons > Manage add-ons > System add-ons_

(!) Please DO NOT disable Analytics Client Plugin if you have JSD installed. It will disable service desk reports plugin immediately.

Flag notifyUsers=false not working. The users are still receiving the notifications.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run any command (Post/delete) on the terminal and add the flag notifyUsers=false
 {code}curl -v -u username:password -X DELETE http://INSTANCEIP:8080/rest/api/3/attachment/{10002}?notifyUsers=false{code}
 # The users will still receive the notifications. 

h3. Expected Results

Delete the attachment without sending the notification through email.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When pasting a screenshot from the clipboard into a comment in text mode using Safari, Jira will display a message stating that the browser is not supported and will fail to attach the file.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Take a screenshot. On a Mac, we can use {{Shift + Control + Command + 3}} to take the screenshot into the clipboard.
# Using Safari, add a new comment to an issue. While using text mode, attempt to paste the screenshot present in the clipboard in the comment box.

h3. Expected Results
A pop up will show up with instructions on how to perform these steps, and asking for confirmation for the screenshot to be uploaded.

h3. Actual Results
The pop up will show without the screenshot present in the clipboard. Additionally, another pop up will be present in the top right corner of the screen instructing to use either Firefox or Google Chrome.

h3. Workaround
# Instead of copying the screenshot from the clipboard, save it to a file and drag the file into the comment box.
# Alternatively, use *Visual Mode* to upload the image. The downside of this method is that it doesn't add the *thumbnail* tag to the image.
fields.summary: Uploading attachments from the clipboard into a comment with text mode using Safari will fail

fields.description:
Hello,

Soon, we started a collaboration with a old client of us but this time with Atlassian applications, they got a servicedesk and a Jira server license and they had a security audit ofer them, this is what they've got from it and they need to solve these issues asap.

 

Summary:

Many of the problems that applications are solving require limits to the number of times a function can be used or action can be executed. Applications must be “smart enough” to not allow the user to exceed their limit on the use of these functions since in many cases each time the function is used the user may gain some type of benefit that must be accounted for to properly compensate the owner. For example: an eCommerce site may only allow a users apply a discount once per transaction, or some applications may be on a subscription plan and only allow users to download three complete documents monthly.

 

Vulnerabilities related to testing for the function limits are application specific and misuse cases must be created that strive to exercise parts of the application/functions/ or actions more than the allowable number of times

 

Attackers may be able to circumvent the business logic and execute a function more times than “allowable” exploiting the application for personal gain.

If anyone intercept the request when he try to recover any password, the application configuration permit to send unlimited request to server:

 

[http://prntscr.com/q5jfvr]

In anyone intercept the request, after completing all filed from "Initiere" menu, send multiple request to server with a ticket. The application permit to create another ticket without captcha security code:

 

http://prntscr.com/q5jg1h

In anyone intercept the request, after completing all filed from "Maturare" menu, send multiple request to server with a ticket. The application permit to create another ticket without captcha security code:

[http://prntscr.com/q5jg85]

 

Countermeasures:

The application should have checks to ensure that the business logic is being followed and that if a function/action can only be executed a certain number of times, when the limit is reached the user can no longer execute the function. To prevent users from using a function over the appropriate number of times the application may use mechanisms such as cookies to keep count or through sessions not allowing users to access to execute the function additional times.

 

We would be very glad if this issue will be taken as a security risk.

 

Best regards,

Cristian L.
fields.summary: Incorrect implementation of functions

fields.description:
Hello,

Soon, we started a collaboration with a client that had an security audit over the Atlassian stack products(Jira server,ServiceDesk) therefore, they found out the following issue;

 

Summary:

If session tokens (cookies, username, sessionID) are used as parameters for some POST or GET requests, an attacker can modify them to impersonate another user and gain privileges or data manipulation.

Quote: 

Session token exposed in url when we try to upload a file in comment section

Expectations:

Sensitive session information should not be exposed in POST parameters that can be manipulated.

http://prntscr.com/q5jdog

Thank you in advance,

Cristian L.
fields.summary: ATL_TOKEN Variable should be hidden from public access

	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
*Workaround 1*
Administrator can delete and recreate the user and ask them to set the password via "Set my password" button within 24 hours. This way, the user will be able to set the password.

*Workaround 2*
Disable "External user management" flag on General Configuration page.
fields.summary: Requesting password reset link results in error 500 after clicking on the link if External user management flag is set to ON

fields.description:
Currently when you share a link to a Jira ticket on Slack / Whatsapp / Teams / Skype there is no real preview or "rich preview" information. So the preview looks like an "ugly" url with some default text like "XXXX Jira - Login".

My suggestion is to add Rich Preview meta tags to make it look a little better and for example add a Jira / Atlassian logo as image ("meta og:image").

Details on the available / necessary meta tags:

[https://medium.com/@richardoosterhof/how-to-optimize-your-site-for-rich-previews-527ed13a6d69]
fields.summary: Add "Rich Preview" meta tags + image for nice sharing on chat / slack / whatsapp / ...

fields.description:
In Plan mode, I want a view of issues which includes either/both of labels and issue status. I can do this by configuring Custom Fields (see JSWSERVER-3922), but this has a drawback of adding an additional text row to each card, making a list harder to scan and greatly reducing the number of issues that can be shown at a time. I would instead ask that custom fields be displayed inline as pill labels, similar to how GitHub displays labels next to issue summaries. (See attached image.)

I believe that this is a very sought after feature. (Refer to the long stream of +1 comments in [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Software-questions/Displaying-labels-on-the-backlog/qaq-p/185391].)

!image-2019-12-02-14-44-03-812.png!
fields.summary: As a user, I can enable custom fields in backlog view without doubling card height

fields.description:
*Issue*:
* We just transitioned from JIRA Server to JIRA Cloud and the vertical edit scroll bar is gone in JIRA Cloud. This makes editing anything longer than the height of a screen very impractical and time consuming because the top formatting bar scrolls off the top of the page and you have to used the browser window's scroll bar to access this menu, but whatever selections you make are not visible until you scroll back down to where you are making the edits.

*Steps to Reproduce*:

(1) Do anything in JIRA Cloud to get into edit mode, such as adding a comment to a JIRA.

(2) Write a long comment which is longer than the height of your screen.

*Expected*:
* The top text formatting bar remains visible on the screen - I don't really care how you do it, either by making this a floating menu, or by restoring the removed vertical scroll bar.

*Actual*: 
* The top text formatting bar scrolls out of sight.

*Workaround*: None.
* With the removal of the "Text"/"Visual" option in JIRA Cloud, I cannot even switch to "Text" mode anymore to make manual markup edits to bypass having to use the scrolled out of view formatting menu.
fields.summary: JIRA Cloud needs a vertical scroll bar to access the Formatting Tool Bar when editing

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When using the German Language, the "Linked Issue" field would display as this:
 !Linked_Issue_DE.JPG|thumbnail! 
The field name is displaying in 2 lines which is slightly misaligned and is too close to the field above.

h3. Suggested Solution
# Changing the translation from "Verknüpfte Vorgänge" into "Verknüpfung"
# Edit the template and insert one or more empty lines between the two fields.

h3. Workaround 
Manually editing the Language pack to change the translation to "Verknüpfung" (Go to *<JIRA_INSTALL>/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins*, edit the language pack
(i) The file name should look something like this "*jira-core-language-pack-de_DE-7.7.1.v20180122100646.jar*". The version number would vary depending on your Jira version.
fields.summary: Improve the German translation for "Linked Issue" field

fields.description:
As of now, the environment filed in Jira is of type "Multi line text", it is of not much use, customer would like to have it as Multi select field. Can we have this changed? 

Please refer below screenshot for more details:

!image-2019-12-02-15-29-15-001.png!
fields.summary: Change datatype of Environment field

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Jira only prevents using the same name for Dashboards and Filters to each user themselves. However, other users are able to create new Dashboards and Filters using the same name by an existing Dashboards or Filters created by other users. This can cause confusion should the Dashboards and Filters made accessible to the other users, which would make it look redundant.

Example:
# User A creates a Dashboard called "Red"
# User A creates another Dashboard and tries to call it "Red"
** Jira will throw an error that a Dashboard with the name exists
# User B creates a Dashboard called "Red"
** Dashboard gets created. Should users have access to both Dashboards, they would see two "Red" Dashboards made by User A & B.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a configuration option (can be enabled/disabled) in Jira to prevent using the same name for Dashboards and Filters across the whole instance.

h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Ability to prevent using the same name for Dashboard and Filters

fields.description:
An idea for the installation wizard:

I always check the option that the wizard should backup everything before setup, this last quite a long but it is important here.

Unfortunately, the backup is always being created in the Jira directory, which is not so optimal because it happens quite often and sometimes there is not enough space in the disk.

It would be very fine if I could have it create the backup… on another disk which is left for Jira's backups only with plenty of space for all the backps.
fields.summary: Add the ability to change Jira backup path

fields.description:
Current: 

You can only enable JMX MBeans via "/secure/admin/JmxMonitoringAction.jspa"

Proposed:

Create a jpm.xml property called `jira.jmx.enabled` and default it to `false` as it presently is upon installation.
{code:java}
        <property>
            <key>jira.jmx.enabled</key>
            <default-value>false</default-value>
            <type>boolean</type>
            <admin-editable>true</admin-editable>
            <sysadmin-editable>false</sysadmin-editable>
        </property>
{code}
You should also bind this value to the "/secure/admin/JmxMonitoringAction.jspa" page to ensure a complete user experience.

Reason:

At present, you have to configure JMX setting via setenv files, but you have to browse into Jira to actually enable JMX monitoring for Jira.  This seems an odd experience as an administrator.
fields.summary: Enable JMX monitoring via jira-config.properties

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Corrupted or wrong data in custom field can lead to situation where the user is informed that the issue hasn't been created, but the corrupted issue is in fact saved and rollback doesn't happen.

Process of creation of Jira issue consists of 3 steps:
 # Issue is created,
 # Custom field is filled by data,
 # Issue is indexed.

If the second step fails the issue persist in the database with corrupted state and the third step will not happen.

There are 3 problems when the situation mentioned above occurs:
 # User is informed about issue not being created, although the issue exist
 # User is able to repeatedly click the create button. This creates another corrupted issue, because the form with error message stays open
 # Issue is not indexed, which causes it to not show up until next reindex, making it even harder to understand that the issue was created

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use steps to create issue from JRASERVER-70398 (click the "Create" button multiple times)
 # Cancel the creation operation and go to the project to find out how many issues are in it
 # Reindex project
 # Find out that there are new duplicated issues in the project

Other triggers of this issue:
 * JRASERVER-65114
 * JRASERVER-65762

Message returned by Jira correctly describes the result of issue creation operation.
User is not allowed to create multiple issue with the same form without selecting the "Create another" checkbox.

{noformat}
We can't create this issue for you right now, it could be due to unsupported content you've entered into one or more of the issue fields. If this situation persists, contact your administrator as they'll be able to access more specific information in the log file.
{noformat}
Issue with corrupted data is created and will not show up in the issue search nor it will be possible to transition it to other status. The form used to create the corrupted issue can be used to create another issue without any warning.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When the *Group Object Filter* attribute in the external directory connector is used to filter out a group, this group is deleted from Jira.

However, it there's a filter or dashboard shared with this group, the share permissions are not updated. The shared object will still be seen as shared with the group that has already been deleted from Jira.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Connect an external directory and sync groups
 # Share a filter with an external group
 # Filter out the group so it doesn't get sync'd
 # Verify the group is deleted from Jira by the next sync
 # Go to *Shared filters* in the admin part of Jira.
 # View the share permissions of the filter.

h3. Expected Results
Deleted group shouldn't show in the filter permissions.
h3. Actual Results
Deleted group still shows in the filter permissions.
 +*Notes*+
* If the deleted group is local, it will also be deleted from the filter share permissions.
* The issue also impacts shared dashboards.
* Due to this bug, changing the owner of an impacted shared filter is not possible. The old owner will not be changed and no error message will be prompted to the admin. This behaviour can't be reproduced with shared dashboards. 

h3. Workaround
 * The filter owner or a user with edit permissions should remove the group from the filter share permissions.
 * The groups that were deleted by have filters shared with them can be retrieved by running this query:
{code:sql|bgColor=#f8f8f8}
SELECT param1, COUNT(id) FROM sharepermissions WHERE entitytype='SearchRequest' AND sharetype='group' AND param1 NOT IN (SELECT group_name FROM cwd_group) GROUP BY param1;
{code}

 * The corrupted share permissions can be removed by running
{panel:bgColor=#ffe7e7}
(i) Take a backup of your DB and stop Jira before running this.
{panel}
{code:sql|bgColor=#f8f8f8}
DELETE FROM sharepermissions WHERE entitytype='SearchRequest' AND sharetype='group' AND param1 NOT IN (SELECT group_name FROM cwd_group);
{code}
fields.summary: Filtering out a group from an external directory does not remove it from the shared object (filter or dashboard) permissions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the attempt of linking a Confluence page to a Jira issue, users that search for Confluence page that with Korean characters will see a 'Status 400 – Bad Request' error. 

This only happens in IE 11 and not Chrome or Firefox.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup an application link between Jira and Confluence 
# Create pages that has Korean characters either in the page title or page content
# Link the Confluence page in a Jira issue
## In Jira issue view, click the 'More > Link' option
## Select 'Confluence Page'
## Click on 'search for a page'
## Search for the Korean characters
(i) The search string used in this example: {{세상}}

h3. Expected Results
Search results are returned correctly. 

!Chrome_page_search.png|thumbnail!

Sample of request URL sent from Jira in Chrome or Firefox.
{code}
http://localhost:8851/jira851/rest/confluenceIssueLink/1/confluence/search?query=%EC%84%B8%EC%83%81&appId=872ca86c-d3c2-3dd6-9ff1-97c739c05d77&spaceKey=&maxResults=10&_=1574929645189
{code}

h3. Actual Results
Search returned no results.

!IE_page_search.png|thumbnail!

In the sample of request URL sent from Jira, we can see the search query is not encoded correctly in IE. 
{code}
"url": "http://localhost:8851/jira851/rest/confluenceIssueLink/1/confluence/search?query=ì¸ì&appId=872ca86c-d3c2-3dd6-9ff1-97c739c05d77&spaceKey=&maxResults=10&_=1574923316719"
{code}

h3. Workaround
Use Chrome or Firefox browser.
fields.summary: Searching for Korean characters when attempting to link a Confluence page returns Status 400 – Bad Request

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 9 October 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ddfdec|titleBGColor=#ddfdec|bgColor=#ffffff}
We found out that the {{ResultSet closed}} error is caused by a misalignment of various properties that control batch and buffer sizes during indexing.

We aligned these properties in the upcoming Jira 8.14.0 release.

If this problem affects your instance running Jira < 8.14.0, you can apply the fix yourself by setting the following values in [{{jira-config.properties}}|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/edit-the-jira-config-properties-file-in-jira-server-317194938.html]:
{noformat}
jira.index.issue.maxqueuesize=4000
jira.index.sharedentity.maxqueuesize=4000{noformat}
To be double sure, you can ensure that your instance does use the default value of {{jira.index.background.batch.size = 4000}}. You can check this on the [Advanced Settings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/configuring-advanced-settings-938847828.html] page (requires Jira System Administrator rights).
{panel}
 
h3. Issue Summary

Customers are experiencing upon upgrading to Jira 8.0+ from 7.0+ that full lock and re-index runs into {{ResultSet closed}} error from their database (happens on SqlServer and Postgres so far).

The trend from customers is that most of the time their {{dbconfig.xml}} has default max pool size of 20 threads, and Jira 8.0+ has default re-index thread of 20.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Unable to reproduce, requires data and load.
h3. Expected Results

Reindex completes successfully.
h3. Actual Results

Reindex fails with the error message -

	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.index.ReIndexAsyncIndexerCommand.call(ReIndexAsyncIndexerCommand.java:18)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.index.AbstractAsyncIndexerCommand.call(AbstractAsyncIndexerCommand.java:26)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.TaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(TaskManagerImpl.java:537)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.TaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(TaskManagerImpl.java:495)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)

Caused by: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: This ResultSet is closed.
	at org.postgresql.jdbc.PgResultSet.checkClosed(PgResultSet.java:2696)

{noformat}
The following might also be found in the logs too, showing that the pool sized has maxed out
{code:java}
Dangerous use of multiple connections: taken => count=2; marks=[1-0]; pool=20/20
{code}
h3. Workaround

If this problem affects your instance running Jira < 8.14.0, you can apply the fix yourself by setting the following values in [{{jira-config.properties}}|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/edit-the-jira-config-properties-file-in-jira-server-317194938.html]:
{noformat}
jira.index.issue.maxqueuesize=4000
jira.index.sharedentity.maxqueuesize=4000{noformat}
To be double sure, you can ensure that your instance does use the default value of {{jira.index.background.batch.size = 4000}}. You can check this on the [Advanced Settings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/configuring-advanced-settings-938847828.html] page (requires Jira System Administrator rights).

h3. September 2020 Update:

_We are closely monitoring_ _JRASERVER-70327__, and, as it is a complex issue, we’ve decided to address it in parts. As a first step, we released a fix for_ _JRASERVER-65457_ _that should should mitigate some of the problem. We will continue to closely follow the current ticket and will take further steps based on how it develops._

fields.description:
If two users are editing the same JIRA ticket and User 1 fills out something in Field A and saves it if User 2 fills out a different value in the same Field A and saves it the changes made by User 1 are overwritten.

Even if the users edit different fields the change made by user 2 will rollback the change that user 1 made since
fields.summary: Collaborative editing
